About Me

Hello! My name is Sky :). Welcome to my about me page! I am currently a high school student in BC and will attend a post-secondary school to major in computer science starting this September of 2021. Occasionally, I enjoy playing a few tunes on the piano and watching animated films.

Frankly, I never thought that I would pursue a career path in computer science; I thought it was not my forte. But during the pandemic, my brother, who is also my mentor for this project, suggested that I learn Python. So, later on, I searched up a tutorial on Python and printed my first hello world. Ever since then, I've loved learning about programming and discovered a new interest.

The past year, between 2020 and 2021, I've only built relatively simple projects in Python, ranging from text-based programs to functioning games (bug-filled but functioning). So now I am excited to have the opportunity to showcase what I have learned through this website and how teaching yourself a new subject can yield satisfying results.

My Experience
x
-

How did I learn python?

I first started by watching a beginners tutorial on Python and following the exercise questions in the python crash course. Most of my resources come from youtube videos, articles and books and a large portion of my time is spent searching for help on StackOverflow (it comes in handy when I am stuck on a problem).

Any difficulties while learning how to program?

At first, I sped through the beginner's course material relatively quickly and, much of the content I comprehended. But as the problems got harder to solve, I found it more difficult to extend my learning through practice since most of the suggested projects/exercises were either too difficult or too easy. I slowly realized that it is easier to maintain a consistent learning pattern at the beginning. However, as the learning rate starts to plateau during the more difficult concepts, it becomes increasingly harder to stay motivated and continue learning.

What is a more effective approach to learning?

Active learning, as opposed to only passive learning, is the most effective way to fully comprehend a concept. While learning how to use python, I engaged in active learning by practicing my coding skills through Leetcode problems and creating projects without the assistance of a tutorial.
